meanings.definition: To broadcast simultaneously on radio and television.
meanings.sent1: During the game, they will simulcast the final match on both TV and radio.
meanings.sent2: The radio station will simulcast the concert live on television as well.
meanings.sent3: It was funny when they tried to simulcast the news but ended up showing a cooking show instead.
meanings.sent4: Her voice simulcasted across the airwaves, reaching listeners far and wide.
meanings.sent5: The magician's performance was simulcasted to every household, creating a sense of unity among viewers.

meanings.definition: A program or event that is broadcast simultaneously on radio and television.
meanings.sent1: The awards ceremony was a simulcast, reaching audiences through both TV and radio.
meanings.sent2: Fans eagerly awaited the simulcast of the music festival on their favorite channels.
meanings.sent3: The simulcast of the talent show made it seem like the singers were in two places at once.
meanings.sent4: The presidential address was a simulcast that captivated the nation with its powerful message.
meanings.sent5: The simulcast of the sports event brought together fans from different platforms, creating a shared experience.
